title: Define quasi-adiabatic evolution U_T (sorry)
description: Define the quasi-adiabatic evolution U_T(t) as the solution to d/ds Ũ_T(s) = -i H(s/T) Ũ_T(s), Ũ_T(0) = 1, with U_T(t) := Ũ_T(tT). State existence and unitarity. Sorry the ODE existence theorem for now.

title: State Adiabatic Theorem (Thm 2, sorry)
description: State Theorem 2 (Teufel's adiabatic theorem without gap condition): for a C²-family {H(t)} of self-adjoint operators with spectral projection P(t) that is C²-continuable through level crossings, lim_{T→∞} (1-P(t)) U_T(t) P(0) = 0 uniformly. Sorry the proof.

title: Define BitString, computational basis, and N-qubit Hilbert space
description: Define BitString N (e.g. Fin 2 ^ Fin N or BitVec N), the computational basis identification |z⟩, and H_N := EuclideanSpace ℂ (Fin (2^N)). This is the foundational setting for all subsequent definitions.

title: Define linear interpolation H_lin(B,C)(t)
description: Define H_lin(B,C)(t) := (1-t)B + tC for t ∈ [0,1], the interpolating Hamiltonian used in the QAA. Establish that it is self-adjoint and C² in t.

title: Prove minimization analogue of Theorem 7
description: Prove: if B is a mixer, |ι⟩ ∈ S is a lowest energy state of B|_S, and C encodes a minimization problem (Sopt = eigenspace of C|_S for its smallest eigenvalue), then lim_{T→∞} U_T(1)|ι⟩ ∈ Sopt. This is the central research contribution.

title: Prove Theorem 7: Convergence of QAA
description: Prove Theorem 7 modulo sorryed lemmas: if B is a mixer, |ι⟩ ∈ S is a highest energy state of B|_S, then lim_{T→∞} U_T(1)|ι⟩ ∈ Sopt. Proof structure: (1) P-F gives non-degeneracy of λ_max(t) for t<1, (2) analytic perturbation extends P₁ through level crossings, (3) apply Adiabatic Theorem.

title: Define PhaseSeparator Hamiltonian (Def 1)
description: Formalize Definition 1: H is a phase separator for a COP with solution space S and optimal space Sopt iff (i) H is diagonal in the computational basis, (ii) the eigenspace of H|_S for its largest eigenvalue equals Sopt.

title: Define irreducibility for matrices (Def 3)
description: Formalize Definition 3: A matrix A ∈ Cⁿˣⁿ is irreducible iff it has no proper A-invariant coordinate subspace of Cⁿ. Check whether Mathlib already has Matrix.IsIrreducible or equivalent.

title: Define MixerHamiltonian (Def 5)
description: Formalize Definition 5: B ∈ L(H) is a mixer for a COP with solution space S iff B(S) ⊆ S, B|_S is component-wise non-negative in the computational basis, and B|_S is irreducible.

title: State Perron-Frobenius theorem (Thm 4, sorry)
description: State Theorem 4 (Perron-Frobenius): if A ∈ Cⁿˣⁿ is component-wise non-negative and irreducible, then A has a non-degenerate largest eigenvalue. Check Mathlib first; sorry if not present.

title: State analytic perturbation theory lemma (sorry)
description: State the Kato analytic perturbation theory result [14, Thm 6.1]: for an analytic family of symmetric matrices, eigenvalue curves are analytic and spectral projections extend analytically (C^ω) through level crossings with removable singularities. Sorry the proof.

title: Identify conditions for minimization analogue of Thm 7
description: Determine the precise conditions under which Theorem 7 extends to minimization (lowest energy states). The obstruction is that Perron-Frobenius only covers largest eigenvalue. Investigate routes: (a) negate problem, (b) impose conditions on -C|_S, (c) find a P-F analogue for smallest eigenvalue.

title: Define diagonal Hamiltonians and matrix representation
description: Define what it means for a Hamiltonian to be diagonal in the computational basis. Set up the matrix representation of operators on H_N in the computational basis, including the objective Hamiltonian C := Σ_{z} f(z) |z⟩⟨z|.

title: Prove Corollary 6: diagonal + irreducible → irreducible
description: Prove Corollary 6: if A ∈ Cⁿˣⁿ is diagonal and B ∈ Cⁿˣⁿ is irreducible, then A + B is irreducible. This is used in the proof of Theorem 7 to establish that H_lin(B,C)(t)|_S is irreducible for t ∈ [0,1).
